defs.docs: # Manifest Dir Macros

defs.name: path
defs.docs: Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path.

attributes.value: / Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: exist_path
defs.docs: Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. (multiple components are supported) If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must exist.

attributes.value: / Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. (multiple components are supported) If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must exist.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: directory_path
defs.docs: Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be an existing directory.

attributes.value: / Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be an existing directory.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: not_directory_path
defs.docs: Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must not be an existing directory.

attributes.value: / Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must not be an existing directory.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: file_path
defs.docs: Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be an existing file.

attributes.value: / Allows input an absolute path, or a relative path. If a relative path is input, it will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be an existing file.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: relative_path
defs.docs: Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path.

attributes.value: / Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: exist_relative_path
defs.docs: Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must exist.

attributes.value: / Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must exist.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: directory_relative_path
defs.docs: Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be a directory.

attributes.value: / Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be a directory.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: not_directory_relative_path
defs.docs: Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must not be a directory.

attributes.value: / Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must not be a directory.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: file_relative_path
defs.docs: Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be a file.

attributes.value: / Allows input a relative path. It will be relative to the CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR (a directory where your `Cargo.toml` located). Returns an absolute path, and it must be a file.

defs.name: absolute_path
defs.docs: Allows input a absolute path. Checks and returns the absolute path.

attributes.value: / Allows input a absolute path. Checks and returns the absolute path.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: exist_absolute_path
defs.docs: Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it exists and returns the absolute path.

attributes.value: / Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it exists and returns the absolute path.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: directory_absolute_path
defs.docs: Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it is a directory and returns the absolute path.

attributes.value: / Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it is a directory and returns the absolute path.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: not_directory_absolute_path
defs.docs: Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it is not a directory and returns the absolute path.

attributes.value: / Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it is not a directory and returns the absolute path.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: file_absolute_path
defs.docs: Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it is a file and returns the absolute path.

attributes.value: / Allows input a absolute path. Checks whether it is a file and returns the absolute path.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: get_file_name
defs.docs: Gets the file name for other purposes. If there is no file name, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.

attributes.value: / Gets the file name for other purposes. If there is no file name, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: get_file_stem
defs.docs: Gets the file stem for other purposes. If there is no file stem, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.

attributes.value: / Gets the file stem for other purposes. If there is no file stem, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: get_extension
defs.docs: Gets the file stem for other purposes. If there is no file extension, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.

attributes.value: / Gets the file stem for other purposes. If there is no file extension, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
proc_macro

defs.name: get_parent
defs.docs: Gets the parent for other purposes. If there is no parent, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.

attributes.value: / Gets the parent for other purposes. If there is no parent, the default value will be used, or a compile error will be shown.
/ Multiple components can be input by using commas to separate them.
